#Text=UEFA Euro 2016 , day 8 : Italy-Sweden , Czech Republic-Croatia , Spain-Turkey
#Text=Saturday , June 18 , 2016
#Text=Yesterday in UEFA Euro 2016 , Italy defeated Sweden 1 – 0 and assured their advancement to the knock-out stage .
#Text=Croatia vs Czech Republic resulted in a 2 – 2 draw and Spain defeated Turkey 3 – 0 as Álvaro Morata scored twice .
#Text=Spectators from the Croatian end threw flares before the final whistle .
#Text=File photo of David de GeaImage : Saul Tevelez .
#Text=Group E — Italy 1 – 0 Sweden
#Text=Italy faced Sweden in the first match of the day .
#Text=Sweden led in terms of ball possession but , in the 88th minute , Éder scored for Italy .
#Text=Italian captain Gianluigi Buffon was yellow carded in injury time as he delayed a goal-kick .
#Text=Italy numerically assured their advancement to the knock-out stage by winning this game .
#Text=Group D — Czech Republic 2 – 2 Croatia
#Text=Croatia were 1 – 0 up at half time as Ivan Perišić scored in the 37th minute .
#Text=FC Barcelona midfielder Ivan Rakitić scored a second goal for Croatia chipping the ball over Petr Čech just before the one hour mark .
#Text=Later , Milan Škoda scored from a header in the 76th minute for the Czechs .
#Text=The match seemed to being inching towards a 2 – 1 victory for Croatia but Czech Republic won a penalty and Tomáš Necid equalised late in the match , having replaced Jaroslav Plašil .
#Text=In the 86th minute , spectators threw flares on the ground and delayed the game by five minutes .
#Text=A hearing is scheduled to take place today .
#Text=Later , Davor Šuker , president of the Croatian Football Federation , said , " We will seek the help of the French police [ to investigate ] [ ... ]
